item.title: R install for user on a CentOS Linux supercomputer
item.description: An up-to-date R install is a key component of any biologist’s bioinformatics toolkit. In this post, I will walk through some code that I used to solve the problem of installing the latest version of R, R v3.4.4 (the “2018-03-15, Someone to Lean On” release), at the user level on a Linux supercomputing cluster running CentOS 5/6/7. First, I’ll give some background information that will be useful for following along.
